RTL Updates:

Assertion Fix:
All $display statements are now guarded by named assertions so they can be disabled. See HSD 5190985.
Bug Fix:
Fixed coding error in the virtual port that prevented the router from getting to a power gatable state after receiving a successful completion without data.
Coverage Group Fix:
Fixed coverage group for measuring empty to full conditions of the FIFOs.
Methodology Update:
sbc_map has been rewritten to meet the new CTECH methodology for SIP. Any customers that want the old format can find a unsupported version named sbc_map.legacy in the common source folder.
PCRS:
PCR 58001: Increased ingress queue size maximum to 31. sbcinqueue.sv was re-written to be move flexible.
PCR 58073: CTECH Methodology updated to match BXT. Any IPs seeking the old map file can find a copy in the common source folder.

Dynamo/Collage Updates:

General Updates:
Moved forward to Collage version 2.1.p11. Added a temporary hack to the custom_pre.setup file to work around a bug in tsetup for this version of Collage.
Reverted to an older version of coretools for corekit creation to avoid getting ahead of customer coretools versions.
The corekit was updated to correctly generate Collage interfaces for the variable number of async clocks and their req/ack signals.
Added consistency checks to SBR corekit.
Added ability to draw a graph of the SBR network. The graph can be found in sbr_network_graph.pdf, located next to the SBR workspace in the directory structure.
Fabric Spec Updates:
Removed constraints on VISA ULM ID. It can now be configured from the fabric spec files.
Updated the corekit so the number of VISA output lanes can be configured from the fabric spec files. Valid values range from 1 to 4. See HSD 5190617.
Updated the corekit so the number of bits in a VISA lane can be configured from the fabric spec files. Valid values are 8, 16, and 32. See HSD 5209817.
HSD 1013433656VISA Lane Numbers Adjustable from Dynamo
HSD 1014339509VISA Lane Width Adjustable from Dynamo
Interface Updates:
Added async clocks to Collage interfaces of type IOSF::SB::Clock with names of the form "async{clknum}_clk_src." This name was chosen because "async{clknum}_clk" was already taken for the clk request/ack interfaces.
Changed the Collage interface used for PGCB signals from COL::PGCB_Fabric to Fabric_Power_Gating.
Added pmc_sbr_restore_b to the Fabric_Power_Gating Collage interface.
Sideband Router has two collage interfaces for the PGCB signals (only use one):
  • pgcb_intf -- of type COL::PGCB_Fabric
  • pgcb_intf_fab_pwr_gtng -- of type Fabric_Power_Gating

Backend Updates:

General Updates:
IP level backend runs after using the helper scripts will now generate a RTL list based on CTECH_LIB_NAME.
When running ACE the environment variable CTECH_LIB_NAME must be set to match the CTECH library name that will be used for backend testing.
ATPG:
Now runing both Stuck-At and At-Speed tests. At-speed is typically above 90%.
CDC:
ACE CDC TCL flow now supported. Configurable waivers had to be re-written. There may be some missing feature combinations, file an HSD if you suspect a waiver is missing at the IP level.
Waivers written to minimize Warnings in Chassis compliant router configurations.
Directory structure for CDC changed to workaround ACE limitations:
  • Input Collateral found at: ip_root/tools/cdc/tests/router_module_name/
  • Results found at: ip_root/tools/cdc/results/tests/router_module_name/
LEC:
Retention cells are now fully supported in UPF enabled FV runs.
SpyglassLP:
Moved the SpyglassLP scripts from tools/upf to tools/spyglasslp.
SpyglassDFT:
Now supported. In the future ACE will be used.
UPF:
Removed UPF isolation on feed-through paths in the router. Affected signals include: enpirdy, epcirdy, npfence, pcdstvld, npdstvld. Added waivers from some "feed-through" paths that also went to an AON domain (Spyglass gets confused by these).

Validation Updates:

Functional Coverage: 96%

Line Coverage: 97%
